messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Bush On Schools
messages.msgSnippet: Can we spell H*$*L*D*A???  Of course he will have some hsers out there campaigning.  Farris expects to get a job out of this. Now, KIPP is not an idea, KIPP
messages.messageBody:
Can we spell H*$*L*D*A??? Of course he will have some hsers out there
campaigning. Farris expects to get a job out of this.

Now, KIPP is not an "idea," KIPP is a reality.

Personally, I don't see too much difference between H$LDA's school-at-home,
required to be approved curriculum and ps. Either way you have kids locked
into sitting like good little robots for 5 hours or more of learn or else.

Lynda

----------
> From: Sue Amiot <samiot@...>
> To: Unschooling-dotcom@egroups.com
> Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Bush On Schools
> Date: Tuesday, September 05, 2000 10:51 AM
>
> >From what I've seen on the Bush net page he is not in favor of
> putting any restrictions on the homeschooler. I think KIPP is an
> idea he's considering for ps. You have to admit there's a lot of
> room for improvement in ps for those who can not or do not wish to
> homeschool. In fact in Tampa, FL area his campaign has a homeschool
> mom who acts as a coordinator contact for homeschool.
>
